etymologies: mid 16th century: via Latin from Greek monopōlion, from monos ‘single’ + pōlein ‘sell’

definitions: the exclusive possession or control of the supply of or trade in a commodity or service

examples.text: his likely motive was to protect his regional monopoly on furs

shortDefinitions: exclusive control of supply of or trade in commodity or service

definitions: a company or group having exclusive control over a commodity or service

examples.text: areas where cable companies operate as monopolies

shortDefinitions: company or group having exclusive control over commodity or service

definitions: a commodity or service in the exclusive control of a company or group

examples.text: electricity, gas, and water were considered to be natural monopolies

shortDefinitions: commodity or service in exclusive control of company or group

definitions: the exclusive possession, control, or exercise of something

examples.text: men don't have a monopoly on unrequited love

shortDefinitions: exclusive possession or control of something

definitions: a board game in which players engage in simulated property and financial dealings using imitation money. It was invented in the US and the name was coined by Charles Darrow c.1935.
shortDefinitions: board game involving simulated property dealings
